In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

The few times I have seen her, she seems to hyper-focus on ONE issue, and almost overdoes it. She tries to quickly get me out of her office after dealing with that ONE issue only, even if I ave 2 or 3 medical issues that need to be dealt with. To get the appropriate care, I would need to go to separate visits for all my individual issues and needs.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

My greatest fear is that they will not listen or take serious my myriad of chronic and acute illnesses. They seem to often deal with my main issue that I came in for, but don't want to give me the time to deal with the other smaller yet still importan reasons I came in.

I was prescribed an antibiotic and after about a week my skin started itching and then broke open and oozed puss. It started on my hand and then covered my whole body. I was in the Dr.'s office every day for just shy of two (2) weeks. Since the Dr. didn't know what I had, I started researching and asking my nurse friends. One day I walked in and informed him I had Steven Johnson's Syndrome because he had prescribed a Novocain antibiotic and I'm allergic to Novocain.

I did some research online to see what other things could be causing my pain. One of them was ovarian cysts. I went to a gynecologist and she confirmed that I had cysts.

The doctor was in the middle of saying that she would up the dose of the medicine for my high blood pressure when I mentioned that I had read that it could be causing my constant  cough.   She changed me to another medicine and the cough went away.

I feel like for the most part, I am capable of handling my own information and understanding it in the medial field. But there are times that I have had some pretty confusing paperwork. And I don't know if it's because I'm stupid, young, or sheltered that I have a hard time comprehending some of these things. Usually its just things like medication contradictions, or confusing information about test results.  But I certainly know how to call my own doctor and obtain my own health records, and to get help, etc.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Although currently I do not have a primary care provider, I have had many MANY throughout my 22 years of existence and there were so many that didn't know what the heck they were talking about. When I can go online and find medical documents from the actual US government along with WHO and the CDC to name a few, showing contradictory information to what I am told by a doctor, it starts to shake your faith in em. Then we also have to get into the deeper part of, do we trust the government? Do we trust WHO or the CDC? And if we do, should be believe them over our own doctors? Should we trust our doctors medical training was equal to or superior to the training of those that work for the government? Can we trust those workers even have credentials and how easily can that be faked or covered up? As you can see the reasons run very very deep and is much more than I care to type here.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Well usually when I go its cause theres something wrong with me thats causing a pretty bad ailment and so I already go into it expecting something bad. I can be a bit of a hypochondriac and that may play on my experience a little bit. But then its also because a lot of the procedures they must do to check you out, are uncomfortable or downright painful. And sometimes, doctors tell you that there is something they found that concerns you and they get you super worried, when they shouldnt say anything until test results come back. Many times I have had them distress me thinking I had an issue such as an enlarged/inflamed liver, just to find out theres absolutely nothing wrong with my liver. The days of stress from worrying waiting for those results is unnecessary.

I can't say there's been many situations in my life that I have actually had to put use my medical knowledge,  cause honestly I haven't really done much or been in situations that people could end up injured.
